derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (originally in the sense 'favourable reception, approval'): from late Latin acceptatio(n-), from the verb acceptare (see accept)The current sense dates from the early 17th cent

means.word_mean: 2. the accepted meaning of a word
3. the act of accepting with approval; favorable reception;
